reviewsJson.markdown:
**Setup:** Plume Veil RDA; dual parallel @ .35Î©; cotton wicks; 45W

**Testing:** FA Bilberry @ 3%; Aged: 3 days

**Flavor description:**  Tart, jammy, very dark blueberry taste.  

**Off-flavors:**  none

**Throat hit:** 5/10

**Uses:**   Use 0.5-2% as a tart accent to other dark fruits in desserts/bakeries.  This is a fairly strong concentrate.

**Pairings:** Dark fruits, creams, tea, chocolate.

**Notes:**   This flavor is very powerful, it is recommended that you start at 0.5% and work up as desired so it doesn't over-power a mix.  May also require a bit more steep time to reach full potential compared to most fruits.  I plan to re-visit this one in a week or so and include any further notes.

**Bonus notes:**  I had to look up what a Bilberry even was, turns out they're closely related but not quite the same as a common American blueberry: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bilberry


EDIT: [Link to all of our flavor reviews in the wiki](https://www.reddit.com/r/DIY_eJuice/wiki/index/flavor_reviews)
reviewsJson.author: wh1skeyk1ng
reviewsJson.title: Bilberry
